@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #83477 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
Seems like it could cause issues where code suddenly breaks if there is a refactor that fixes this.

My first thought was P-low because I couldn't think of a scenario where this would happen by chance or unintentionally e.g. I usually look up these directives in the documentation - I find this issue somewhat funny :-)
(but ok for P-medium if there are implications I'm not aware of)

I couldn't think of a scenario where this would happen by chance or unintentionally

hyd-dev said:

I discovered this through rust-analyzer, which tries to auto-complete something like #[allow(clippy::empty_loo with #[allow(clippy::clippy::empty_loop)], and then I found that syntax actually works.

hm interesting, wasnt aware of the Zulip thread :)
So this issue is on the rustc compiler rather than rust-analyzer, correct?
the first one is that rust-analyzer suggests clippy::clippy::empty_loop
the second is that rustc accepts it
ah ok makes sense. Thanks to both for the clarifications!
I've added a "Background" section to the issue description.
